snippet: The flooding killed at least three people and cut off major highways, isolated towns and forced the closing of the main campus of the University of Colorado.
abstract: Flash flooding across Colorado kills at least three people and cuts off major highways, isolates mountain towns and forces closing of the main campus of the University of Colorado.

byline.original: By DAN FROSCH and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
byline.contributor: Dan Frosch reported from Boulder, and Timothy Williams from New York.

lead_paragraph: The flooding killed at least three people and cut off major highways, isolated towns and forced the closing of the main campus of the University of Colorado.

headline.main: Colorado Towns Are Left Stranded in Deadly Floods
headline.print_headline: Colorado Towns Are Left Stranded In Deadly Floods
